body:
I am artificially setting very long install path : 

```
/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/project/proj20/pramod_scratch/report_flush/tmp_new/aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa/install
```

And if I try to install `automake`

```console
$ spack install automake
```

I see 

```
checking for perl... /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/project/proj20/pramod_scratch/report_flush/tmp_new/aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa/install/gcc-4.8.5/perl-5.26.2-ka6syh/bin/perl
checking for tex... tex
checking for yacc... yacc
checking for lex... lex
checking whether autoconf is installed... yes
checking whether autoconf works... no
configure: error: The installed version of autoconf does not work.
    Please check config.log for error messages before this one.
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/data/project/proj20/pramod_scratch/SPACK_DEPLOYMENT/spack-deploy/workspace/compilers/HOME_DIR/spack/var/spack/stage/automake-1.16.1-yk6ievwypvnyro7egceqyznnsltxfpkr/automake-1.16.1/configure' '--prefix=/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/project/proj20/pramod_scratch/report_flush/tmp_new/aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa/install/gcc-4.8.5/automake-1.16.1-yk6iev'

1 error found in build log:
     13    checking for perl... /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/project/proj20/pramod_scratch/report_flush/tmp_new/aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
           aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa/install/gcc-4.8.5/perl-5.26.2-ka6syh/bin/perl
     14    checking for tex... tex
     15    checking for yacc... yacc
     16    checking for lex... lex
     17    checking whether autoconf is installed... yes
     18    checking whether autoconf works... no
  >> 19    configure: error: The installed version of autoconf does not work.
     20        Please check config.log for error messages before this one.
```

If I look into config.log I see:

```
Written by David J. MacKenzie and Akim Demaille.
configure:2937: $? = 0
configure:2945: result: yes
configure:2952: checking whether autoconf works
configure:2959: cd conftest && autoconf -o /dev/null conftest.ac
/bin/bash: /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/data/project/proj20/pramod_scratch/SPACK_DEPLOYMENT/spack-deploy/workspace/compilers/HOME_DIR/spa: No such file or directory
configure:2962: $? = 127
configure:2971: result: no
configure:2974: error: The installed version of autoconf does not work.
    Please check config.log for error messages before this one.
```

See the trimmed path `/bin/bash: ..... compilers/HOME_DIR/spa: No such file or directory`

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$  uname -a
Linux xxxx 3.10.0-514.26.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Jun 30 05:26:04 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$  lsb_release -d
Description:	Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.3 (Maipo)
```
title: Issue while installing automake for "long" install path
